shortdesc.ph: Enables the beauty effect and sets its options.

p.codeblock: virtual int setBeautyEffectOptions(bool enabled, const BeautyOptions& options, agora::media::MEDIA_SOURCE_TYPE type = agora::media::PRIMARY_CAMERA_SOURCE) = 0;
public abstract int setBeautyEffectOptions(boolean enabled, BeautyOptions options);

ul.li: This method depends on the beauty effect dynamic library . If the library is deleted, this feature cannot be enabled.
This feature requires high device performance. When calling this method, the SDK automatically detects the device's performance capability.
This method is only supported on Android 5.0 or later.
This method depends on the dynamic library . If this library is deleted, the feature cannot be enabled.
This feature requires high device performance. When you call this method, the SDK automatically detects the device capabilities.

section.title: Timing
section.p: Call this method after or startPreview.
Call this method after calling or startPreview.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable the beauty effect:
: Enable the beauty effect.
: (Default) Disable the beauty effect.

The media source type to apply the filter effect to. See .
If using the camera to capture local video, use the default value PRIMARY_CAMERA_SOURCE.
If using a custom video source, set to CUSTOM_VIDEO_SOURCE.

Whether to enable the beauty effect:
: Enable the beauty effect.
: (Default) Disable the beauty effect.

ul.li:
< 0: Failure.
-4: The current device does not support this feature. Possible reasons include:
The current device performance does not meet the requirements for beauty effects. It is recommended to use a high-performance device.

< 0: Failure.
-4: The current device does not support this feature. Possible reasons include:
The device capabilities do not meet the requirements of the beauty effect. Agora recommends switching to a high-performance device.
The device runs an Android version lower than 5.0, which does not support this feature. Agora recommends upgrading the device or the OS.
